tweets.text: UPDATE - After the appeal we put out last night to @EnvAgency @ClintonDevon @kiergroup & @NESouthWest there was no nest destruction today at the River Otter Restoration Project in Devon and the partners are reconsidering their plans - thank you . Top work @WiseBirding et al . https://t.co/A8KSk5gcuE
I am hearing that @EnvAgency @ClintonDevon @NESouthWest may have finally seen sense!? @ChrisGPackham @Natures_Voice @DevonWildlife https://t.co/fAB6uuBlCW

@davemh72 @LoneRanger77777 @DrMickSalt @Samanth33412592 @StinkStopthe @RedIndustries2 @EnvAgency @ClareDinnisEA @DefraGovUK @Cap_it_off @SimonTagg @AaronBell4NUL We can only wonder what they have put in, but I bet they never thought it would get to this stage, EA and PHE need to really act fast in the best interests of the public as the truth will come out just like the terrible smell did! https://t.co/HUc1TkHjjP

@Independent @StinkStopthe @EnvAgencyMids @AaronBell4NUL @PHE_uk You really need to investigate this and find out the truth, its something never experienced at this level, we will never find out what is buried but we suspect gypsum with household waste that was banned in 2014, our cries for help were ignored that it was not the normal!

Breaking News . @EnvAgency have sanctioned the destruction of breeding birds tomorrow at the Lower Otter Restoration Project . This is #HS2 part 2 . PLEASE THINK AGAIN @ClintonDevon @kiergroup @NESouthWest Please follow @WiseBirding and RT https://t.co/I8Wv40YKqy
@a_merrydew @EnvAgencyMids Your right it has got worse, and tonight is going to be another sleepless night.

Really proud of this #nfm project that we delivered for @SCRiversTrust @EnvAgencyNW. We delivered a range of slow the flow, storage and surface flow disruption interventions. urls.title: The Chilterns AONB - News
urls.description: Buckinghamshire Council and the Chilterns Conservation Board have serious concerns about the impacts of HS2‚Äôs tunnelling operations on Buckinghamshire‚Äôs aquifer and chalk streams. These concerns relate to pollution resulting from tunnelling operations, increasing abstraction of water and impacts on the flow of significant chalk streams, such as the River Misbourne. A joint Position Statement has been issued with a series of questions regarding these concerns, and the Council and the Chilterns Conservation

tweets.text:
Here is a good statement reflecting our concerns with regard to HS2 Tunnelling and the impact on the chalk aquifer https://t.co/tUIdNMbtSW
It is with sadness we announce a very compliant @EnvAgency have approved the tunnelling without any public consultation.

@Samanth33412592 @EnvAgency @RedIndustries2 @SimonTagg @AaronBell4NUL @DefraGovUK @StinkStopthe @Cap_it_off Not if we've got anything to do with it. We will fight them every inch of the way ‚úä‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

@ClareDinnisEA @robbiedyson @EnvAgencyMids @JamesBevanEA @Cap_it_off @StinkStopthe @StaffordshireCC @NewsNBC You promised an update from the deadline and weekend inspections, has this been issued yet please? I am 2 miles away and yet again experienced ghastly odours and bad breathing air over the weekend resulting in my wife having a 24 hr debilitating migraine. Will this ever end?

@ClareDinnisEA @robbiedyson @EnvAgencyMids @JamesBevanEA @Cap_it_off @StinkStopthe @StaffordshireCC Yes @ClareDinnisEA We've had the weekend from hell & I personally have had such bad heart palpitations from the toxic stench that I nearly ended up hospitalised. We haven't heard a peep out of you since your staged video & photo opportunity. Come on we need answers @StinkStopthe

@EnvAgencyMids have been in touch with me to confirm that the wind speed indicator issue on the Silverdale MMF was resolved on 14/04/21. It won‚Äôt #StopTheStink but at least we‚Äôll know how fast the Stink is travelling.
